3BE7586AC7134C5AA49465BDCC4B56AA.description: Select and use appropriate visual and/or digital tools to enhance verbal communication and add interest. (LA.8.SL.2.e)

652867879E724AE3BCFBF50E05E2683E.description: Demonstrate awareness of and sensitivity to the appropriate use of words (e.g., stereotypes, multiple meanings of words). (LA.8.SL.2.d)

2C558BF775CB485A860369F372A432C0.description: Analyze the purpose of information being presented and evaluate its motives (e.g., social, commercial, political). (LA.8.SL.2.c)

DFA21E1B2F864C5EBBDD6BF266D46FF3.description: Convey a perspective with clear reasoning and valid evidence. (LA.8.SL.2.b)

FD15FC916B1D481480F6716A463F36E6.description: Demonstrate and adjust speaking techniques (e.g., appropriate eye contact, pacing, adequate volume, clear pronunciation) for a variety of purposes and situations, including interpreting 8th grade texts. (LA.8.SL.2.a)

0ED21A180B424B4AACCE4D7B9FD8B2FE.description: Students will present claims and findings, emphasizing key ideas in a focused, coherent manner at grade level; with relevant descriptions, facts, details, and examples to clarify themes or central ideas;  in which the organization, development, and style are appropriate to the discipline, audience, and/or content.

E21DD52A00F747BDA0798897D58D21C9.description: complete a task following complex, multi-step directions. (LA.8.SL.1.e)

10A7118DDA7F4ADB8BFB1E362C7868E8.description: demonstrate active and attentive listening skills (e.g., eye contact, nonverbal cues, taking notes, summarizing, questioning). (LA.8.SL.1.d)

B61F4353F6EB4C929374719F642C9047.description: converse with peers and adults in an all-inclusive manner to foster positive relationships while respecting diverse perspectives. (LA.8.SL.1.c)

E379FF1EF55341668BDD11401D7B647F.description: demonstrate interpretation of verbal and non-verbal messages in a conversation. (LA.8.SL.1.b)

000200ADEA944320BEE672F2965A65BD.description: ask relevant questions to build on ideas, clarify their own ideas, or acquire or confirm information. (LA.8.SL.1.a)

BD9C59D8EE6145C6A3A3A3A59D5026A3.description: Students will initiate and participate in structured discussions and collaborations about grade-level topics and texts; for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences to express ideas, share knowledge, and generate new understanding.

A7282E70620A478393799A7E702373DB.description: practice safe and ethical behaviors when communicating and interacting with others digitally (e.g., safe information to share, utilize appropriate sites and materials, appropriate language use, respect diverse perspectives). (LA.8.W.6.e)

8C7B53A1C5164C64AE9F55AE52FB3839.description: demonstrate academic integrity by avoiding overreliance on any one source and citing sources within text (e.g., parenthetical and numerical); provide a list of sources using a standard format. (LA.8.W.6.d)

C1ABAC4F40F34C3F9EA931DB198498C4.description: select and use appropriate note-taking formats to collect and organize information. (LA.8.W.6.c)

D96881AB270C4841B54818F9A9E3BA25.description: locate and evaluate the credibility of evidence (e.g., the expertise or motivation of the creator of an information product, potential bias and/or deception) from print and digital sources to generate and answer questions and create new understandings. (LA.8.W.6.b)

DB425000B5DF4231A843AFB0D181CE71.description: integrate evidence into writing by quoting or paraphrasing data and conclusions while avoiding plagiarism. (LA.8.W.6.a)

3CDFC17B042F4060B80BB4DFAA3E877D.description: Students will gather and use credible evidence from multiple trustworthy sources and assess its relevance in answering the research question(s), at grade-level.

91F95BC9262247ED87527ECFA1316471.description: provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation(s). (LA.8.W.5.d)

F05AABDD51B5405887E1DA65C3A70EFF.description: use appropriate transitions and domain-specific vocabulary to clarify relationships among ideas and concepts. (LA.8.W.5.c)

2172271C9BCD451A910BF52D823DBD2C.description: develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, and/or other information and examples. (LA.8.W.5.b)

645D5C48EBD149EBAA1E9AFA11C624CA.description: develop a clear topic and provide a specific focus; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories or sections including text features, illustrations, and/or multimedia elements. (LA.8.W.5.a)

D008936B44A74C3E8EF369BF68C117C4.description: Students will write informative/explanatory pieces at grade-level, to clearly convey ideas and information in which the development and structure are appropriate to the task, purpose, and audience.

61E3C7B8B43049D5985558D0C6BC65EF.description: provide a conclusion that follows from and supports the argument(s) presented. (LA.8.W.4.f)

975E393662B646EC96C99A2A721C8BF0.description: adapt style and tone appropriate to the norms and conventions of the task and discipline. (LA.8.W.4.e)

54DD6B4A75694F8A98D0716210ED43BD.description: use words, phrases, and key vocabulary to create cohesion and clarify the relationship between the claim(s) and supporting evidence. (LA.8.W.4.d)

7DACC4EF419F496AA6A40252DF86756D.description: explain and cite relevant evidence from multiple credible sources. (LA.8.W.4.c)

ED1E7198CD9743CEBBBB5BAE97559702.description: introduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or supporting claims, and develop a structure in which ideas are grouped logically. (LA.8.W.4.b)

722E3D60EE36402AAC573D6B47E1E8D8.description: develop a structure to sequence ideas appropriately; introduce a clear claim where appropriate. (LA.8.W.4.a)

0A7CC20CD4EA48C98922DB43D3B5F01F.description: Students will write arguments that develop a perspective with supporting reasons and evidence, organized as appropriate to the task, purpose, and audience.

F500B2E5EC8F472DBD95C8769563CD2D.description: provide a conclusion that is clearly related to and reflects upon what is experienced, observed, or left unresolved over the course of the piece. (LA.8.W.3.e)

EA6924D08ECB4FCE84FC819F9134144E.description: use precise words and phrases, descriptive/sensory details, and figurative language to establish mood and tone and convey a vivid picture. (LA.8.W.3.d)

2A1EBA701A9A487AA489730B788A68CF.description: use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole. (LA.8.W.3.c)

6140D42679C147C09B021567FFFD39D5.description: use literary techniques (e.g., dialogue, pacing, description, multiple plot lines) to develop experiences, events, characters, and settings. (LA.8.W.3.b)

07805F429C3E43C29E8A80298A54C40D.description: engage and orient the reader by establishing a conflict, situation, or observation, introducing a narrator and/or character(s), and establishing and maintaining point(s) of view; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically. (LA.8.W.3.a)

07012E0039C94F319D28EB27A687E7E8.description: Students will write in a variety of literary forms at grade level, to convey real or imagined experiences or events in which the development and structure are appropriate to the task, purpose, and audience.

E2204C445D4341C3A018568AFD0F003B.description: use appropriate print and digital/multimedia tools to produce, enhance, and/or publish writing individually or in collaboration with peers. (LA.8.W.2.e)

6ADFBD44FBF7464ABDED0A2014CC0DF9.description: improve and clarify writing by editing and proofreading, considering feedback from adults and peers. (LA.8.W.2.d)

1CE87E1241F84DB5944D436D58801A56.description: improve and clarify the content, structure, and organization of writing by revising, considering feedback from adults and peers. (LA.8.W.2.c)

80D84EB8316D412D882F0C422E83FDB1.description: adapt writing processes to sustain engagement in short and long-term writing tasks of increasing length and complexity. (LA.8.W.2.b)

31D7B5E422FB4EB98528B9EBD40A3561.description: identify and use resources and inquiry tools to plan, organize, and draft writing. (LA.W.2.a)

A51F515D38274F2EA57DF18DB9BA0ABE.description: Students will use a recursive writing process to develop, strengthen, and produce writing at grade level, appropriate to the audience, purpose, and discipline.

EC05FDFC0680474591B6D97058FD3A82.description: write a multi-paragraph composition, varying in sentence structures, using standard rules of grammar and punctuation.

E8408ED1D05E4353B5CB94CBF12D3CD0.description: identify and revise fragment and run-on sentences and inappropriate shifts in verb tense, number, voice, and mood. (LA.8.W.1.f)

AC9CF2AD891041F9A181AE2E5590C181.description: use appropriate parallel structure in words, phrases, and clauses. (LA.8.W.1.e)

77402E599C174937813D614D06975A00.description: distinguish between and use active and passive voice, formal and informal tone, and types of grammatical mood (e.g. indicative, subjunctive, conditional, imperative). (LA.8.W.1.d)

E4169E18C1954A9F90EFC16178CD1C06.description: explain the function of and use different types of verbals in sentences (e.g., gerunds, participles, infinitives). (LA.8.W.1.c)

92EE60929A5D43BCBA436315A70CF999.description: use punctuation (comma, ellipsis, dashes) to indicate a pause or break and an ellipsis to indicate an omission. (LA.8.W.1.b)

8469EAF56C3540158033E7ACB3C4C227.description: apply knowledge of rules for capitalization. (LA.8.W.1.a)

DE535C80B77648149AE65DF3C2008AA6.description: Students will use a recursive writing process to produce clear and coherent multi-paragraph compositions appropriate to the discipline, audience, and /or context.

FB93BD977832489C8E2E931B68D7BEBE.description: distinguish between the connotations of words with similar denotations (e.g., willful, resolute). (LA.8.V.2.c)

2A535B6A27D943D2BE053940B7A21839.description: determine the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words. (LA.8.V.2.b)

C5F25841755645CD8E220F7592250055.description: interpret figures of speech (e.g., verbal irony, puns) in context. (LA.8.V.2.a)

4C323796B273443380B074BC241E27DD.description: integrate general and specialized reference materials to determine or clarify the precise meanings, pronunciations, or parts of speech of words. (LA.8.V.1.c)

26F74DD3A4C6465C99792B2F7BA510D6.description: use commonly occurring Greek and Latin affixes and roots to determine the meanings of words (e.g., recede, precede). (LA.8.V.1.b)

D3B88870A8C64547A600CCD332C99EAE.description: use context clues (e.g. the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) to determine the meanings of words and phrases. (LA.8.V.1.a

0A8333CEB7E0471CAB3DA1AB3E18657D.description: Students will integrate grade-level academic vocabulary appropriately for a variety of tasks and purposes; to interpret an author’s use of figurative, connotative, and technical language in grade-level literary and informational text.

81E4C58A9335492087997BCA17FB0D30.description: read and comprehend a wide range of informational texts of appropriate complexity at 8th grade level, independently and proficiently. (LA.8.RI.8)

E65F87E7DB764AE794F6A9392498BB95.description: analyze regional, national, international, and/or multicultural perspectives to make connections among and distinctions between individuals or ideas within and across a range of informational texts. (LA.8.RI.7)

22FD6A43499046079F57D9660061DC5C.description: analyze the development of an argument and evaluate the effectiveness of the type(s) of reasoning used to support the argument. (LA.8.RI.6)

304BE58BDE634C11A39659C40EB3E7F9.description: analyze how two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic, including where the texts disagree on matters of evidence or interpretation. (LA.8.RI.5)

DA7198778DF84F4D8568FC2E94C0102E.description: Students will cite relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate how an author’s perspective or use of point of view shapes the style and meaning of grade-level informational text.

7BCA6C727947418B8B4A1563632B10CE.description: compare and contrast the structure of a specific paragraph in an informational text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept. (LA.8.RI.4)

0E32F506D3624FD997DC61F31B744090.description: analyze how an author establishes, conveys, and contrasts perspective or purpose in a text and how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints. (LA.8.RI.3)

BEEEABC160014AE1A710510A99A2F120.description: analyze how particular events, interactions between individuals, or key facts and details contribute to meaning. (LA.8.RI.2)

B2DBB7B0199747D6AD3F736C21133669.description: determine two or more implied or explicit central ideas and how they develop over the course of an informational text, including their relationship to supporting ideas.

6B15D843D05E4B3091FD393A5570DFC9.description: Students will cite relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate both the development of themes or central ideas and interaction of individuals, ideas, in grade-level informational text.

F048D00094274FE3B11370364CE2F962.description: read and comprehend a wide range of literary texts of appropriate complexity at the 8th grade, independently and proficiently. (LA.8.RP.8)

7506229F86E449039CE699ABBB6AD0BC.description: analyze regional, national, international, and/or multicultural perspectives to make connections among and distinctions between characters or ideas within and across a range of literary texts. (LA.8.RP.7)

4B940D61C12F4458BA9E10E634E3F1FB.description: synthesize the implied or stated theme(s) in a literary text to draw conclusions and deepen understanding of self and other. (LA.8.RP.6)

8FE43A669C6B4C91856276215891A561.description: analyze how modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works. (LA.8.RP.5)

7EAA40B1B4E54A32AA12B909F7361DD3.description: Students will cite relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate how an author’s perspective or use of point of view shapes the style and meaning of grade level literary text.

C6487D98DCA947AEAA4D9BF54CF0437A.description: compare and contrast the structure of two or more literary texts and how their structures contribute to style and meaning. (LA.8.RP.4)

819596F74C1148FCB43D3AEBABFBA1CC.description: analyze how an author establishes, conveys, and contrasts the point of view of the audience and the characters to create effects such as suspense, humor, or dramatic irony in a literary text. (LA.8.RP.3)

6524A6DD8C954943A983F4A25E2102C1.description: analyze how particular events, lines of dialogues, or descriptive details develop plot, reveal aspects of characters, or create meaning. (LA.8.RP.2)

B75F2B0389394218A6FB32C5C250E637.description: determine two or more implied or explicit themes and how they develop over the course of a literary text, including their relationship to supporting ideas. (LA.8.RP.1)

95C6A13330B84938A5506AA50E00D075.description: Students will cite and use relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate the development and interactions of individual ideas and themes or central ideas, in grade-level literary text.
